alert.note: Alert for Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 5:57AM AKST until January 23 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...The following area, Juneau near the Jordan Square Mall. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 556 AM AKST, River gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain and snowmelt in areas around the Jordan Creek Mall. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding, especially near Jordan Creek. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.1-0.2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible. - For Jordan Creek near Juneau: At 5:00am the stage was 9.82 feet. Flood Stage is 9.7 feet. Forecast: A crest around 9.97 feet is expected around 9:00pm Saturday. Impacts: At 9.2 feet: This is the stage when Jordan Creek is at bankfull and water will begin to inundate areas along the edges of the creek near Race Reality and Jordan Square. At 9.7 feet: Water will inundate the Jordan Square`s front and back parking lots, around Jordan Creek office condominiums with up to one foot of water. Some residential driveways will be flooded and cut off. - Please stay tuned to NOAA weather radio or your favorite local weather news source for updates on this situation.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
